description: Alternative start to A002371, which is the main entry for this sequence.
comments: This sequence gives also the number of digits of the periodic part of the decimal expansion of n/(n-th prime). The periodic part of 1/(n-th prime) (cf. A060283) is in general different from the periodic part of n/(n-th prime) (cf. A060251), but their lengths are equal. - _Klaus Brockhaus_, Apr 01 2001
links: Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
author: _Enoch Haga_
